docs.text: the 13th warrior reeks so badly of melodrama and poor acting that it carries a worst scent than a canine's least appetizing residue .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the best part of the film would be a close contest between the closing credits and a brief moment in the middle where the screen goes entirely white and you hope that the film has slipped and caught ablaze in the projector .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: my vote goes for the ending credits , where you can start trying to put the awful experience behind you .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ibn fahdlan ( antonio banderas ) is an important official who is banished from his home for sleeping with another man's wife .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he encounters a group of norse warriors who convince him to join them on a mysterious journey to be taken by 13 men .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: fahdlan is chosen as the 13th and last warrior in a moment that is so desperately overacted and overdone that numerous persons at the screening i attended broke out into laughter .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the movie proves to be a new low point for banderas , who's acting seems closer to that of his role as the lover and caretaker for a dying gay man in 1993's philadelphia , than that of a warrior .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in the film's supposed pay off scene , he exclaims " i was wrong , these are not men ! " ,
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a line intended to be the most memorable quote of the production .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: unfortunately , banderas delivers it in a fashion that makes chevy chase's career look like oscar material .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film , based on michael crichton's best selling novel , eaters of the dead was shot under that name some three years ago , and after numerous rewrites not only does the dialogue seem completely phony , but the plot is incredibly difficult to follow .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: at the same time , the 13th warrior makes you think about numerous questions .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: questions like " why do the characters always have perfect lighting on them even when it is pitch dark ? " ,
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " why does no one ever have blood cover both sides of their face , but rather just one side ? "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and finally , " will the manager give me a refund ? "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: 90 minutes into the 103 minute film , a man invites of the warriors " come with me , there is a woman who can help . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: unfortunately , there is nothing that could help this film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the most appropriate ending would have been for the 13 men to join hands , form a chorus line , and break into a rendition of " springtime for hitler . "
docs.label: negative
